body:
> Without being tied to `RegistrationService#assertRegistration`, the update of the `last_via` property should then only be done when there is a command subscription request being handled.

EDIT: This actually wouldn't work because we might only have the gateway id as part of the subscription request. So we indeed need to update `last_via` on telemetry and event messages.

issue.title: [#1245] Add indication of GW usage to assertRegistration response JSON
issue.body:
This is for #1245.

The intention of #1245 is that the update of the `last_via` property shall be done in a separate request. In order to decide whether we actually need to do that request, this PR changes the `assertRegistration` return JSON to include the `via` property value.

body:
The solution here shall introduce a new `RegistrationService#updateDeviceLastVia` method and corresponding `RegistrationClient` methods, to be invoked by the Protocol adapters after the `assertRegistration` request was successful.

In order to be able to decide, whether the `updateDeviceLastVia` request is actually needed, `assertRegistration` should also return the `via` property of the device registration data.
Added #1248 for that.

The suggested changes for this issue concerning the Device Registration API (AMQP) are:
- New mandatory operation `Set last-used gateway for device` for the AMQP interface. 
In `RegistrationService` this looks like:
`void setLastUsedGateway(String tenantId, String deviceId, String gatewayId, Span span, Handler<AsyncResult<RegistrationResult>> resultHandler)`
- New mandatory operation `Get last-used gateway for device` for the AMQP interface. 
In `RegistrationService` this looks like:
`void getLastUsedGateway(String tenantId, String deviceId, Span span, Handler<AsyncResult<RegistrationResult>> resultHandler);`
The returned JSON value in the RegistrationResult would contain the gateway device id and the update date.
- With the introduction of the above method, the existing `Get Registration Information` operation of the AMQP interface isn't needed anymore in Hono code, therefore we could mark it as deprecated in M4 and remove it in Hono 1.0 (along with removing all the other non-mandatory operations).

In the `RegistrationClient` interface 2 new corresponding methods get added.
(With the introduction of the Infinispan-based Device Registry we could use an adapted RegistrationClient that communicates via the HotRod protocol with the Infinispan backend for the implementation of these methods.)

@sophokles73, @ctron thoughts on this?

issue.title: [#1245] Extract methods for handling the bit flag used in the Command class
issue.body:
For #1245:
Extract methods for the bit flag used in the Command request id (denoting whether the original reply-to address contained the device id).

Encoding and decoding of the bit flag used in `Command.getDeviceFacingReplyToId`
and `CommandResponse.getReplyToId` has been refactored to use the new
methods as well. Note that for this, the bit flag value in these methods has been switched, making it identical to the flag value used for the Command request id.

This is a preparation for storing an additional option in the bit flag,
denoting whether the old or new command response address pattern was
used.

issue.title: [#1245] Add Registration API methods concerning the last-used gateway.
issue.body:
This is for #1245:

Adds the `setLastUsedGateway` and `getLastUsedGateway` methods to the Device Registration API.

These methods are not used yet. This will come in a follow-up PR.
